moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6
comment: Now white must spend a couple of tempi to improve the position of the bishop on d2.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5
comment: The h-pawn is used as a battering ram in a classical attack against the king's fortress.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3
comment: White has managed to strengthen the position of his dark squared bishop, but white's king position has become weakened. Nevertheless, the demolition of white's kingside will be no easy task.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4

1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3
comment: White organizes the strong counterthreat e3-e4. 18.e4 at once is premature because of 18...Bxg3 19.fxg3 Qd6 20.Qd3 Qc5+ winning.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5
comment: The beginning of a real "Total War "which flares up with great intensity even to the end of the game.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2
comment: The alternative 22.Qd3 is weaker because of 22...f5 23.exd5 Qxe1+ 24.Rxe1 Rxe1+ 25.Kg2 f4! and black has much the better game.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4

1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5
comment: White cannot play 24.Qxf3 because 24...fxe4 gives black a crushing attack.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4
comment:
Who is better? Black's ideas include ...Qg6-h5; and ...Be7 followed by ...g5 with a strong attack. But white has serious
pressure along the c-file. True, 25.Nxd5? doesn't work because of 25...Qxd5 26.Red1 Qf7 27.Rxc5 Qh5! winning.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3
comment: The best move again. 26.Nd4 is a blunder since 26...Qg6 gives two threats (27...Bg5 and 27...Qh5).

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3 Qg6
comment: Black's bishop is still invulnerable; 27.fxe4 fxe4 28.Qd2 Rf3 29.Kg2 Ref8 30.Rf1 Bh4 with a tremendous attack. But my famous rival discovers a new resource for counterplay.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3 Qg6 27. Kg2 Bg5 28. Rxc6 Qh5
comment: I intended to trap white's queen in any case, but the cost is too much for black. Correct was 28...Qxc6 29.Qxg5 Qc2! 30.Bd4 Re6 31.Qe3 (31.fxe4? Qxe4+ 32.Kf2 Rh6 winning) and black has some advantage.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3 Qg6 27. Kg2 Bg5 28. Rxc6 Qh5 29. fxe4 Bxf4 30. Nxf4 Qf7 31. exd5
comment: The table is suddenly turned as white gets a tremendous attack as his two minor pieces and strong central pawns dominate black's queen. But white must still be careful.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3 Qg6 27. Kg2 Bg5 28. Rxc6 Qh5 29. fxe4 Bxf4 30. Nxf4 Qf7 31. exd5 Qb7 32. Ba3
comment: After the game, we discovered the shot 32.Rg6!! which comes close to punishing me for the super-optimistic 28...Qh5. But in sharp time pressure, it is never too easy. After 32...Rd8, there is 33.Rd1 Rc8 34.Rd2 Qb4 35.Re2 Rc3! 36.e6 Rfc8 37.Nh5 (37.e7! Kf7 38.Rxg7+ Kxg7 39.e8=Q Rxe8 40.Rxe8 Kf7 41.Bxc3 Qxc3 42.Re2 is equal) 37...Kh7 38.Rxg7+ Kh6 which is unclear; or 33.e6 Rxd5 34.Rxg7+ Qxg7 35.Bxg7 Rd2+ 36.Kf3 Kxg7 37.a4 with a roughly level game.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3 Qg6 27. Kg2 Bg5 28. Rxc6 Qh5 29. fxe4 Bxf4 30. Nxf4 Qf7 31. exd5 Qb7 32. Ba3 Rc8 33. Rec1
comment: 33.Bxf8 Rxc6 34.dxc6 Qxc6+ 35.Kf2 Kxf8 36.e6 g5 with a clear edge for black.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3 Qg6 27. Kg2 Bg5 28. Rxc6 Qh5 29. fxe4 Bxf4 30. Nxf4 Qf7 31. exd5 Qb7 32. Ba3 Rc8 33. Rec1 Rfe8 34. e6 Rxc6 35. Rxc6
comment: 35.dxc6 Qa6 36.c7 g5 is good for black.

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3 Qg6 27. Kg2 Bg5 28. Rxc6 Qh5 29. fxe4 Bxf4 30. Nxf4 Qf7 31. exd5 Qb7 32. Ba3 Rc8 33. Rec1 Rfe8 34. e6 Rxc6 35. Rxc6 g5 36. e7
comment: Despair, as knight moves lose, e.g., 36.Nh5 Rxe6!

moves: 1. c4 e6 2. Nf3 d5 3. e3 Nf6 4. b3 c5 5. cxd5 exd5 6. d4 Nc6 7. Be2 cxd4 8. Nxd4 Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bd6 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. Nc3 O-O 12. O-O Bf5 13. g3 Qd7 14. Re1 h5 15. Bc1 h4 16. Bb2 hxg3 17. hxg3 Ng4 18. Bf3 Rae8 19. Rc1 Qe6 20. e4 Bc5 21. Bxg4 Bxg4 22. Qd2 Bf3 23. Qf4 f5 24. e5 Be4 25. Ne2 Be7 26. f3 Qg6 27. Kg2 Bg5 28. Rxc6 Qh5 29. fxe4 Bxf4 30. Nxf4 Qf7 31. exd5 Qb7 32. Ba3 Rc8 33. Rec1 Rfe8 34. e6 Rxc6 35. Rxc6 g5 36. e7 gxf4 37. gxf4 Qb5
comment: The fight is over, as black's queen is free at last.
